definition: to force into exile/to be exiled/in exile
to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade
to die/to lose/to be gone/to flee/deceased

sentences.english: We learn from Justinian that the original was written in exile.
sentences.chinese: 我们从查士丁尼，原来写在流亡中。

sentences.english: They also narrate the decline that began during his reign and culminated in the exile.
sentences.chinese: 他们还讲述了衰退期间开始他的统治，最后于流亡。

sentences.english: Part three deals with the exile examplified in G.
sentences.chinese: 第三部分集中论述《G》中的流亡主题。

sentences.english: Mr Thein Sein has also appealed to exiled dissidents to come home.
sentences.chinese: 登盛先生也呼吁持不同政见的流亡者返回家园。

sentences.english: Mr. Thaksin faces a two-year jail term for corruption charges and lives overseas.
sentences.chinese: 他信因腐败指控面临两年的监禁，现在流亡海外。

sentences.english: He attended Paris' Sorbonne University and later spent time in exile in the French capital.
sentences.chinese: 他就读于巴黎索邦大学，然后流亡法国首都。

sentences.english: More diseases are thought fields, ap pension money has exiled shame.
sentences.chinese: 身多疾病思田里，邑有流亡愧俸钱。

sentences.english: Exile groups have condemned the policy as an attempt to assimilate Uighurs into Han culture.
sentences.chinese: 流亡团体指责此政策企图同化维族。

sentences.english: The so-called government in exile founded by the Dalai Lama practices theocratic rule.
sentences.chinese: 达赖喇嘛建立的所谓流亡政府实行的是神权统治。

sentences.english: What time must it be when the escaped hungry wolf ate the paymaster?
sentences.chinese: 流亡的饿狼会在什么时分吃掉出纳员？

sentences.english: He lived in exile in Sudan beginning in 1992.
Al-Mabhouh has lived in exile in Damascus for years.
sentences.chinese: 马巴胡赫在大马士革流亡多年。

sentences.english: She was hesitant to mention the part about Diego being exiled here.
sentences.chinese: 她犹豫了一下，没有提迭戈在这儿流亡的事。

sentences.english: You shall become a restless wanderer on the earth.
sentences.chinese: 你将成为土地上不得休息的流亡者。

definition: to run away from trouble/to flee from calamity/to be a refugee
to run away/to go into exile
(lit.) leftover men/(fig.) loyalist adherents of a former dynasty/surviving members of an ethnic group
to meet with disaster/killed/in the clutches of the enemy/to fall foul of/in danger
refuge/to take refuge/to seek asylum (political etc)
to wander about destitute/to be stranded
the country ruined and the people starving (idiom)
